page.title: 05THE MINERS STRIKE 1984
page.content: {THE MINING STRIKE 1984 { }The miners strike started on the 12th of March 1984 and finished about the same time a year later. My family were only getting Â£35 per week. My sister,who had left school,was getting Â£25. She gave Â£10 to my Mum and kept the rest for herself. I was getting free dinners at school and I was getting them through the holidays as well. I don't think we could have coped if my nannas and aunties were not helping us. My dad was also getting a food parcel every week. For the working pickets there was a soup kitchen where they could get breakfast,dinner and tea. With this strike it was hard because our family hardly got any money to buy food. My dad found out that people at Hatfield were giving out food parcels.
